aboutMe.name: Mahnsi Ruparelia
aboutMe.subtitle: Msc Computer Science at York University
aboutMe.content: Hi! Iâ€™m Mahnsi, a passionate developer, researcher, and Computer Science student. I'm interested in Operating Systems, low-level computing, concurrency, Linguistics, and Geography! Check out my site!

projects.name: UniSphere - Full Stack E-Commerce Website
projects.description: A full-stack E-commerce shopping website using Java, JAX-RS, and mySQL for backend services including session tracking, authentication, and inventory management.

projects.name: Song popularity prediction model
projects.description: Used machine learning tools to predict song popularity using a Kaggle dataset.

projects.name: Bar FM
projects.description: Music stats website for Last.fm users.

projects.name: Recycle AI
projects.description: Hackathon project created for GenAI Genesis 2024 at UofT. It is a web app that uses computer vision to identify recyclable materials and provide users with information on how and where to properly recycle them.

experience.name: Software QA Intern at Environics Analytics
experience.description: My first internship! I worked as Software QA Intern at a really cool data company. I learned about the software development and software testing life cycle, and analyzed and documented software defects which contributed to a significant reduction in bugs. I also automated existing QA processes with C# scripts, which improved team efficiency. This was my first time collaborating in an Agile environment, and I gained tons of valuable experience. This internship gave me a new perspective on my career.

experience.name: Undergraduate Researcher at York University
experience.description: I conducted research and development on an LLM-native Operating System project at the Performant and Available Computing Systems Lab at York University. Implemented the user space for a conversational Operating System using C and Python.

experience.name: Data Engineer Intern at TD
experience.description: As a Data Engineering Intern at TD Bank, I built and maintained ETL processes and pipelines using Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and PySpark to automate and scale data operations. This internship taught me so much about big data systems and working with large codebases in a corporate environment. I met alot of really cool people too :) from befriending other interns to coffee-chatting seniors; I got a fresh perspective on the industry and got tons of great advice. and free swag lolz
